In most cases, administrators do not have enough time to react before a crash occurs.  The size of your root file system, even as workload expands because good practice dictates that applications and data go into one of the four file systems we created as LVM logical volumes in Table 2-1.  As application and system data becomes more voluminous, you can quickly and easily expand vg_work by adding another minidisk as a physical volume. This process can be done in minutes and does not require an outage.  Recovery of a Linux system that uses LVM for the root file system is a needless complexity that can be avoided.
